Finishing
Coil Roses into rose shape and 
sew to Leaves as pictured. 
Sew Roses to Vine as pictured, 
centering Roses between Vine 
Leaves.

materials: Caron® Cotton Cakes™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 530 yds/485 m) Rose Whisper (57022) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 8" [20.5 cm] tall x 50" [127 cm] long (excluding ties).
gauge: 14 sts and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Bunting Motifs (make10)
Note: Knot fringe onto Bunting as you finish each Motif.
Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
Ch 4. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: (RS). (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc. Ch 2) all in 4th ch from hook. Join with sl st to top of ch‑3.
2nd rnd: Ch 4 (counts as dc, ch 1). *(3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in next ch‑2 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * once more. (3 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) all in next ch‑2 sp. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch‑4.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in ch‑1 sp. Ch 1. *(3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in next ch‑2 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch‑1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * once more. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in next ch‑2 sp. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of ch‑3.
4th rnd: Ch 4 (counts as dc, ch 1). 3 dc in next ch‑1 sp. Ch 1. *(3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in next ch‑2 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch‑1 sp. Ch 1) twice. Rep from * once more. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in next ch‑2 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in next ch‑1 sp. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch‑4.
Fasten off.
Fringe
Cut strands of yarn 10" [25.5 cm] long. Taking 1 strand, fold in half and knot into fringe along 2 sides of Bunting Motif and trim evenly as shown in picture.
Ties and Joining
Ch 20 (tie). With RS facing, join tie with sl st to top right ch‑2 sp of Bunting.
Work sc evenly across all Bunting Motifs to join, working 1 sc in each ch‑2 corner sp. Ch 20 (tie). Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each of 316 Soft White A and 376 Burgundy B.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Each Garland measures 52” (132 cm) long x 2” (5 cm) wide.
gauge: 12 sts and 7 rows dc = 4” CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
GARLAND (make 2)
With A, ch 163 loosely.
Row 1 (right side): Dc in 4th ch from hook, *dc in each of next 5 ch, [dc2tog over next 2 ch] twice, dc in each of the next 5 ch, 2 dc in next ch**, 2 dc in next ch; repeat from * across, ending last repeat at **; turn – 10 repeats. Fasten off A, join B.
Row 2: With B, ch 3, dc in first st, *dc in each of the next 5 sts, [dc2tog over next 2 sts] twice, dc in each of the next 5 sts, 2 dc in next st**, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * across, ending last repeat at **, turn. Fasten off B, join A.
Row 3: With A, repeat Row 2.
Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft™ (6 oz/170.1g; 315 yds/288 m) Main Color (MC) Pumpkin (39765) 1 ball
Contrast A Gold (39782) 1 ball
Contrast B Autumn Maize (COL0008) 1 ball
Contrast C Autumn Red (39730) 1 ball
Size U.S. D/3 (3.25 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Leaf: Approx 21/2" [6 cm] x 5" [12.5 cm]. Garland: Approx 68" [172 cm] long.
gauge: 20 sc and 24 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Leaves (make 4 in each color).
Ch 17. See diagram on page 2. 
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook.  
1 sc in each of next 3 ch.  1 hdc in each of next 4 ch. 1 dc in each of next 4 ch.  1 tr in each of next 3 ch.  7 tr in last ch. Working into opposite side of ch, 1 tr in each of next 3 ch.  1 dc in each of next 4 ch.  1 hdc in each of next 4 ch.   
1 sc in each of next 3 ch.  2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 
*1 sc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. 1 dc in next st. (3 tr. Ch 3. Sl st) in next st. Rep from * twice more. 
1 sc in each of next 2 sts. (1 hdc. 3 dc. 1 hdc) in next st.  1 sc in each of next 2 sts. **(Sl st. Ch 3. 3 tr) in next st.  1 dc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from ** twice more. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Do not fasten off. 
Stem: Sl st in next st. Ch 5. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook.  1 sc in each of next 3 ch. Join with sl st to first sc.  
Fasten off. 
Garland Assembly
With B, *ch 20. Join Leaf (MC) with sl st at top of Stem. Ch 20. Join Leaf (A) with sl st at top of Stem. Ch 20. Join Leaf (B) with sl st at top of Stem. Ch 20. Join Leaf (C) with sl st at top of Stem. 
Rep from * until all Leaves have been attached. Ch 20. Fasten off.

pattern_name: SCATTERED LUCK CROCHET GARLAND AND CONFETTI
materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Mod Green (01223) 1 ball or 79 yds/72.5 m
Contrast B Hot Green (01712) 1 ball or 79 yds/72.5 m
Contrast C Ecru (00004) 1 ball or 17 yds/15.5 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Garland: Approx 138" [350.5 cm] long. Motifs: Approx 1½" [4 cm] wide.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
3-Leaf Clover (Garland or Confetti: make 20 each in A and B)
Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: *Ch 3. 2 hdc in ring. Ch 3. 1 sl st in ring. Rep from * twice more. Ch 4. Turn. Skip 1st ch from hook. 1 sl st in each of next 3 ch. Sl st in ring. Fasten off.
4-Leaf Clover (Garland or Confetti: make 5 each in A and B)
Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: *Ch 3. 2 hdc in ring. Ch 3. 1 sl st in ring. Rep from * 3 times more. Fasten off.
Garland Joining: Note: Join Clovers tog alternating A and B, noting every 5th Clover will be a 4-Leaf Clover.
Joining row: With C, *ch 10. Sl st in top of Clover. Rep from * until all Clovers are joined (following Note above for sequence). Ch 10. Fasten off.

materials: 1 skein each of 505 Aruba Sea A
661 Frosty Green B
512 Turqua C
316 Soft White D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4 mm [G-6] and 9 mm [M/N-13]
Susan Bates® Easy Pom Pom 2” (5 cm) Maker
measurements: Finished Size: 96” (244 cm) long
gauge: Gauge is not important for this project.
instructions:
POMPOMS
Make 7 Pom Poms each using A, B, C and D, leaving 36” (91.5 cm) ties.
Insert smaller hook under center of ties and draw up a loop using 1 tie strand.
Ch 10, fasten off.
Draw second tie strand through the first ch of first tie strand and pull up a loop.
Ch 10, fasten off.
Leave long ends to attach to Garland.

GARLAND
With larger hook and 1 strand each of A, B, C, and D, ch 201.
Row 1 (Right side): Slip st in second ch from hook and in each ch across, fasten off: 200 slip sts.

FINISHING
Thread the yarn needle with the one Pompom tie. With right side facing and using photo as a guide, secure Pompom tie to 26th slip st. Thread the yarn needle with the remaining Pompom tie and secure it to the fourth slip st from the first. Continue working across Garland attaching Pompoms evenly across, leaving 3 slip sts between each tie.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter™ Holidays (4 oz/113 g; 200 yds/184 m) or Bernat® Handicrafter™ Cotton (1.75 oz/50 g; 80 yds/73 m)
Main Color (MC) Acorn Brown (13520) or Warm Brown (01130) 77 yds/71 m
Contrast A Autumn Red (13430) or Country Red (01530) 62 yds/57 m
Contrast B Squash (13628) or Hot Orange (01628) 62 yds/57 m
Size U.S. E/4 (3.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stuffing.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Garland: Approx 60" [152.5 cm] long.
gauge: 16 sc and 20 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Garland
Make 4 Acorns having A as Color 1.
Make 3 Acorns having B as Color 1.
With MC, make 6 Leaves.
With B, *ch 14. Join Acorn with sl st at top of ‘Hat’. Ch 14. Join Leaf with sl st to last ch of Leaf. Rep from * until all Acorns and Leaves have been joined. Ch 14. Fasten off.
Acorn
With Color 1, ch 15. Join with sl st to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 15 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd and 4th rnds: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 3 times. Join with sl st to first st. 12 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 6 times. Join with sl st to first st. 6 sts.
8th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 3 times. Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off. Thread end through rem loops and fasten securely.
Acorn ‘Hat’
Join MC with sl st to any rem loop on 2nd rnd.
1st rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next loop. 1 sc in each of next 2 loops. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 20 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Stuff Acorn.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 10 times. Join with sl st to first st. 10 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 5 times. Join with sl st to first st. 5 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Skip last st. Join with sl st to first st. Ch 3. Sl st in first ch. Fasten off.
Leaf
With MC, ch 16.
1st row: 1 dc in 3rd ch from hook. *Ch 2. (Sl st. Ch 2. 1 dc) all in next ch. Rep from * to end of ch. Ch 2. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Main Color (MC) Crimson (10786) 1 ball or 80 yds/73 m
Bernat® Plush™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 146 yds/133 m) Contrast A Almandine (68056) 1 ball or 130 yds/120 m
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stuffing.
Susan Bate® yarn needle.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Garland: Approx 60" [152.5 cm] long.
gauge: 10 sc and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm] with Bernat® Plush®.
instructions:
ACORN (make 7)
With A, ch 15. Join with sl st to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 15 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd and 4th rnds: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 3 times. Join with sl st to first st. 12 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 6 times. Join with sl st to first st. 6 sts.
8th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 3 times. Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off. Thread end through rem loops and fasten securely.
Acorn ‘Hat’
Join MC with sl st to any rem loop on 2nd rnd.
1st rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next loop. 1 sc in each of next 2 loops. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 20 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Stuff Acorn.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 10 times. Join with sl st to first st. 10 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 5 times. Join with sl st to first st. 5 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Skip last st. Join with sl st to first st. Ch 3. Sl st in first ch. Fasten off.
LEAF (make 6)
With MC, ch 16.
1st row: 1 dc in 3rd ch from hook. *Ch 2. (Sl st. Ch 2. 1 dc) all in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Ch 2. Fasten off.
GARLAND
With A, *ch 14. Join Acorn with sl st at top of ‘Hat’. Ch 14. Join Leaf with sl st to last ch of Leaf. Rep from * until all Acorns and Leaves have been joined. Ch 14. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball each 4600 White A, 9925 Really Red B, 9251 Coral C, and 5142 Cherry Red D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4mm [US G-6]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Each 5-heart string measures 25” (63.5 cm) long, not including hanging chain. Each heart measures 5” (12.5 cm) at widest x 4” long from center “V” to point.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
HEART (make 15 as shown in Color Sequences)
Ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same st as join, (hdc, dc, hdc) in next sc, sc in next sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in next sc, (hdc, dc, hdc) in last sc; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc, 4 hdc, and 2 dc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in same st as join, (hdc, dc) in next hdc, 2 dc in next dc, (dc, hdc) in next hdc, hdc in next sc, sc in next sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in next sc, hdc in next sc, (hdc, dc) in next hdc, 2 dc in next dc, (dc, hdc) in last hdc; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc, 6 hdc, and 8 dc.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in same st as join, 2 dc in next 4 sts, (dc, hdc) in next dc, hdc in next hdc, sc in next 3 sts, 3 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sts, hdc in next hdc, (hdc, dc) in next dc, 2 dc in last 4 sts; join with slip st in first sc—10 sc, 4 hdc, and 18 dc.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in same st as join, (hdc, dc, tr) in next dc, 2 tr in next 3 dc, 2 dc in next 3 dc, hdc in next 4 sts, sc in next 4 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc, hdc in next 4 sts, 2 dc in next 3 dc, 2 tr in next 3 dc, (tr, dc, hdc) in last st; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc, 10 hdc, 14 dc, and 14 tr.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in same st as join, sc in next 2 sts, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 2 sts; repeat from * twice, hdc in next 9 sts, sc in next 4 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc, hdc in next 9 sts, **hdc in next 2 sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from ** twice, sc in last 2 sts; join with slip st in first sc—one 3-sc group, 13 sc, and 42 hdc.
Round 7: Ch 1, sc in same st as join, sc in next 3 sts, *ch 3, skip next st, slip st in next st; repeat from * around to last 3 sts, ch 3, sc in last 3 sts; join with slip st in first sc—one 7-sc group and 26 ch-3 spaces. Fasten off.
ASSEMBLY
Arrange hearts in 3 groups of 5 each or as desired. Heart to Heart Join: With right side of heart facing, join D with slip st in center st of 7-sc group of Round 7, ch 4; with wrong side of next heart facing, join with slip st in center st of 3-sc group of Round 6. Fasten off. Repeat to join 3 remaining hearts to previously joined hearts.
Hanging Chain: With right side of top heart facing, join D with slip st in center st of 7-sc group of Round 7, ch 30. Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
Repeat Heart to Heart Join and Hanging Chain twice to create 3 garlands.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® “Eco-Ways Bamboo Wool™”: 3 skeins each 3920 Cayenne A and 3650 Dill B.
Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9].
Yarn needle.
10 Chenille Stems, 6mm, in same color as B.
Fabric glue.
abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Felted Branch is 3/4” wide x 40” long. Each Felted Leaf is 4” wide x 33/4” long.
gauge: 14 single crochet = 4”; 16 rounds = 4”, before felting. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the specified gauge.
instructions:
SQUARE (Make 9)
With A, chain 21.
Row 1: Single crochet in 2nd chain from hook and in each chain across – 20 single crochet.
Rows 2-18: Chain 1, turn, single crochet in each single crochet across.
Fasten off.

BRANCH
With B, chain 2.
Round 1: Work 5 single crochet in 2nd chain from hook.
Round 2: Single crochet in each single crochet around.
Continue to repeat Round 2 until piece measures 38” from beginning.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
Thread tail through remaining stitches and pull to close.
Knot to secure.

FINISHING
Weave in ends.

Felting
Place all pieces in washer along with one flat bed sheet.
Place settings for hot wash/cold rinse, lowest water level, and heavy duty agitation. Run through full-cycle twice.
Lay flat until completely dry, pulling Branch to 40” if necessary.
Using leaf template and sharp scissors, cut out 9 leaves from squares.

Assembly
Cut each chenille stem in half. Glue half of each stem to back of each Leaf. Allow glue to dry. Wrap stem of each Leaf around Branch at even intervals. Bend leaves to desired position.

pattern_name: YOU'RE THE ZEST CITRUS CROCHET BUNTING
materials: Lily® Sugar'n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A White (00001) 1 ball or 89 yds/81 m
Contrast B Yellow (00010) 1 ball or 39 yds/36 m
Contrast C Pretty In Pink (01136) 1 ball or 21 yds/19 m
Contrast D Tangerine (01699) 1 ball or 31 yds/28 m
Contrast E Hot Green (01712) 1 ball or 57 yds/52 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
measurements: Citrus Slice Motif:  Approx 4" [10 cm] diameter. Bunting:  Approx 98" [249 cm] long, excluding Ties.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
CITRUS SLICE MOTIF  (make 4 each - Color 2 is C, D, E; make 5 - Color 2 is B) 
Note: Join end of each rnd with sl st in first sc.
With A, ch 2. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join Color 2 with sl st to first sc. Break A. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: With Color 2, ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join A with sl st to first sc. Break Color 2. 30 sc.
6th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join Color 2 with sl st to first sc. Break A. 36 sc.
7th rnd: With Color 2, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc . Rep from * around. Join. 42 sc. Fasten off.

LEAF (make 13)
With E, ch 8.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 hdc in next ch. 3 sc in last ch. Rotate work to cont working up opposite side of foundation ch as follows: skip 1st ch (chain just worked into). 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Note: Alternate joining Motif colors B, C, D, E, ending with 1 B Motif.
Joining: (RS). With A, ch 20 (Tie). Sl st through top of 1st Motif. *Chain for 6" [15 cm] from last Motif. Sl st through top of next Motif. Rep from * until all Motifs are joined. Ch 20 (Tie). Fasten off.
Sew Leaves to tops of Motifs as shown in photo (2 Leaves on each of 1st, 7th, and 13th Motifs; 1 Leaf on each of 2nd, 4th, 8th, 10th, 12th, 15th and 17th Motifs).

materials: Peaches & Creme® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m) Contrast A Black (11040) 1 ball or 87 yds/80 m
Contrast B Ecru (11006) 1 ball or 44 yds/40 m
Contrast C Gold (11605) 1 ball or 28 yds/26 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Dc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and pull through 2 loops on hook.) Twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 55" [139.5 cm] long x 9½" [24 cm] deep at center.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as hdc.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
Moon Backgrounds (make 7)
With A, ch 3.
1st rnd: 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each hdc around. Join.
Fasten off.
Waxing and Waning Crescent Moons (make 2)
With B, ch 21.
1st row: Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. Sl st in next ch. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next ch. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in next ch. Dc2tog. 1 dc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. Hdc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. 1 sl st in each of last 2 ch. Fasten off.
Sew Waxing Crescent and Waning Crescent Moons on Moon Backgrounds as shown in photo.
First Quarter and Third Quarter Moons (make 2)
With B, ch 3.
1st row: 5 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Turn. 5 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 10 hdc.
3rd row: Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 15 hdc.
4th row: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Do not turn. 20 hdc.
5th row: Ch 1. Sl st evenly across straight edge of Moon.
Fasten off.
Sew First Quarter and Third Quarter Moons on Moon Backgrounds as shown in photo.
Waxing and Waning Gibbous Moons (make 2)
With B, ch 3.
1st row: 5 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Turn. 5 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 10 hdc.
3rd row: Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 15 hdc.
4th row: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Do not turn. 20 hdc.
5th row: Working evenly across, Ch 1. Sl st. 1 sc. 2 hdc. 2 dc. 1 tr. 1 dc. 2 hdc. 1 sc. Sl st.
Fasten off.
Sew Waxing and Waning Gibbous Moons to Moon Backgrounds as shown in photo.
Full Moon
With B, ch 3.
1st rnd: 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 hdc.
Fasten off.
Sew Full Moon to Moon Background as shown in photo.
Garland Assembly
With C, ch 181.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 29 ch. Ch 10. Join Waxing Crescent Moon with sl st. Turn. 1 sc in each of next 10 ch to foundation ch. 1 sc in each of next 20 ch. Ch 15. Join First Quarter Moon with sl st. Turn. 1 sc in each of next 15 ch to foundation ch. 1 sc in each of next 20 ch. Ch 20. Join Waxing Gibbous Moon with sl st. Turn. 1 sc in each of next 20 ch to foundation ch. 1 sc in each of next 20 ch. Ch 25. Join Full Moon with sl st. Turn. 1 sc in each of next 25 ch to foundation chain. 1 sc in each of next 20 ch. Ch 20. Join Waning Gibbous Moon with sl st. Turn. 1 sc in each of next 20 ch to foundation ch. 1 sc in each of next 20 ch. Ch 15. Join Third Quarter Moon with sl st. Turn. 1 sc in each of next 15 ch to foundation ch. 1 sc in each of next 20 ch. Ch 10. Join Waning Crescent Moon with sl st. Turn. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Fasten off.

materials: 1 skein each 1932 Minty A
1939 Papaya B
1704 Bubblegum C
1502 Iced Aqua D
1538 Lilac E
1001 White F
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Stitch marker
Yarn needle
1⅜" (35mm) pompom maker or two-tine fork
Sharp scissors
abbreviations: A, B, C, D, E, F = Colors A, B, C, D, E, F
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Each bunny measures 7" (17.8 cm) tall x 5" (12.7 cm) at widest point. Bunting with 10 bunnies is approximately 4’2” (127 cm) measured flat.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
Make an adjustable ring as follows: Wrap yarn around your finger with the yarn tail to the left and under the working yarn. Insert hook through the circle from front to back. Using the working yarn, yarn over and pull up a loop.

Round 1: 8 sc in loop, join to 1st sc with slip st; tighten beginning yarn tail to close ring, place marker to indicate beginning of round – 8 sc.  
Round 2: Ch 1, puff st in same st, ch 1, [puff st in next st, ch 1] 7 times; join last ch 1 to top of 1st puff st – 8 puff sts, 8 ch-1 spaces.
Round 3: Ch 1, *puff st in st, ch 1, puff st in ch-1 space, ch 1; repeat from * around, join with slip st to top of first puff st –16 puff sts, 16 ch-1 spaces.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in same st, 2 sc in ch-1 space, *sc in next st, 2 sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * around, join with sl st to 1st sc – 48 sc.

Head: Begin working back and forth in rows:
Row 1: Ch 1, sc in same st and in next 8 sts – 9 sc.
Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as hdc), turn, hdc in same st as turning ch and in next 8 sts across – 10 hdc.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, fphdc around 1st st and each st across – 10 fphdc.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, skip 1st st, sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog, sc in next 3 sts, sc2tog – 7 sc.

First Ear:
Row 1: Ch 1, turn, skip 1st st, sc in next 2 sts – 2 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in st, 2 sc in next st – 3 sc.
Rows 3-6: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. 
Row 7: Ch 1, turn, skip 1st st, 3 hdc in next st, slip st in last st. 
Fasten off.

Second Ear: Skip st next to inner edge st of 1st ear, attach yarn with slip st to next st.
Row 1: Ch 1, sc in same st and next st – 2 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, 2 sc in next st, sc in next st – 3 sc.
Rows 3-6: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. 
Row 7: Ch 1, turn, skip 1st st, 3 hdc in next st, slip st in last st. 
Fasten off.

FINISHING
Edging: With Right Side facing, attach yarn with slip st to back loop of 1st st where Body and Head meet. Slip st in back loops of each Body st around, slip st in row ends and sts around the head and Ears; join last slip st to 1st slip st. 
Optional: For seamless join, cut yarn from skein but do not finish off. Thread yarn onto tapestry needle. Weave thread under the loops of the next st and back through the middle of the originating st, mimicking the teardrop shape of a st. Weave excess yarn along back of work to secure.

Pompom Tails: With F and a 1⅜" (35mm) pompom maker, (or fork; see below for details), make 1 pompom tail for each bunny. For consistency, ensure that the same number of wraps is used for each pompom. Using sharp scissors, carefully trim each pompom as needed, leaving 4-6" (10-15.25 cm) yarn ends from tie for attaching pompom to Bunny.
Using pompom tie ends, tie pompom on bottom portion of Body between Rounds 2 & 3. Knot securely and trim excess yarn from ties.

Fork Method: If pompom maker is unavailable, use a large two-tine meat serving fork to make pompoms as follows: Wrap the yarn snugly (not too tightly) around the entire fork for a total of 35 wraps. Cut yarn. Using a 10" (25.4 cm) piece of yarn, wrap yarn between the tines and around the middle of the wraps. Pull tightly to cinch and knot securely leaving 4-6" (10-15.25 cm) yarn ends from tie for attaching pompom to Bunny.

Assembly: With F, ch 20. Attach Bunny ear using slip st through the top most st of the 1st ear, ch 5, repeat ear attachment with slip st to 2nd ear, ch 10; repeat the process until all bunnies are attached, ch 20. There should be 10 chs between each Bunny and 5 chs between the ears of each Bunny. 

Hanging Loops (optional): Fold the 1st 10 chs of the ch 20 over to form a loop. With yarn needle and using yarn tail, sew to secure. Repeat for opposite end.  
With yarn needle, weave in all loose ends.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 Skein 311 White
Crochet Hooks: 3.75mm [US F-5]
Split lock stitch marker
yarn needle
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Snowflake Garland measures 48” long x 3¼” wide.
gauge: Snowflake measures 3 ¼” across with smaller hook. 16 sts = 4”; 16 rnds = 4” in sc with larger hook.
instructions:
First Snowflake: Ch 5; join with a slip st to form a ring.
Rnd 1: Ch 1, [2 sc in ring, ch 3] 6 times; join with a slip st in first sc – 6 ch-3 loops.
Rnd 2: Slip st in next sc, ch 1, [(2 sc, ch 3, 2 sc) all in ch-3 loop] 6 times; join.
Rnd 3: Slip st in next sc, ch 1, [(sc, ch 3, sc, ch 5, sc, ch 3, sc) all in ch-3 loop, ch 2] 6 times; join. Fasten off.
2nd Snowflake: Work same as First Snowflake through Rnd 2.
Joining Rnd 3: Slip st in next sc, ch 1, (sc, ch 3, sc, ch 2) all in next ch-3 loop, with wrong sides together, slip st in any ch-5 loop of First Snowflake, (ch 2, sc, ch 3, sc) all in same ch-3 loop, ch 2, [(sc, ch 3, sc, ch 5, sc, ch 3, sc) all in next ch-3 loop, ch 2] 5 times; join. Fasten off. Mark 3rd ch-5 loop from joining.
3rd-15th Snowflakes: Work same as First Snowflake through Rnd 2.
Joining Rnd 3: Slip st in next sc, ch 1, (sc, ch 3, sc, ch 2) all in next ch-3 loop, with wrong sides together, slip st in the marked ch-5 loop of last snowflake made, (ch 2, sc, ch 3, sc) all in same ch-3 loop, ch 2, [(sc, ch 3, sc, ch 5, sc, ch 3, sc) all in next ch-3 loop, ch 2] 5 times; join. Fasten off. Mark 3rd ch-5 loop from joining.
FINISHING: Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Spring Green (0672) 1 ball or 79 yds/72.5 m
Contrast B Tea Leaf (0624) 1 ball or 79 yds/72.5 m
Contrast C Aran (0313) 1 ball or 17 yds/15.5 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume™ crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® yarn needle
measurements: Garland: Approx 138" [350.5 cm] long. Motifs: Approx 1½" [4 cm] wide.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
3-Leaf Clover (Garland or Confetti: make 20 each in A and B)
Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: *Ch 3. 2 hdc in ring. Ch 3. 1 sl st in ring. Rep from * twice more. Ch 4. Turn. Skip 1st ch from hook. 1 sl st in each of next 3 ch. Sl st in ring. Fasten off.

4-Leaf Clover (Garland or Confetti: make 5 each in A and B)
Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: *Ch 3. 2 hdc in ring. Ch 3. 1 sl st in ring. Rep from * 3 times more.
Fasten off.

Garland Joining: Note: Join Clovers tog alternating A and B, noting every 5th Clover will be a 4-Leaf Clover.
Joining row: With C, *ch 10. Sl st in top of Clover. Rep from * until all Clovers are joined (following Note above for sequence). Ch 10. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® With Love®: 1 skein each of 1601 Lettuce A and 1914 Berry Red B.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6mm [US J-10]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: () = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Garland measures 38” (96.5 cm) long x 3” (7.5 cm) wide.
gauge: 18 sts (3 leaves)
instructions:
NOTE
Work last st of first color until 2 loops remain on hook, yarn over with 2nd color, draw through 2 loops on hook, drop first color and carry along tops of sts until needed again.

Special Abbreviations
popcorn: 4 sc in next st, drop loop from hook, insert hook from front to back in first sc, pick up dropped loop, draw through loop on hook.
picot: Ch 3, sl st in top of last dc made.

GARLAND (make 2)
With A, ch 122.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, *skip next 2 ch, (3 dc, picot, 3 dc) in next ch, skip next 2 ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * across, ending with 2 sc in last ch, do not turn – 20 shells.
Row 2: Working across opposite side of foundation ch, sc in each of next 2 ch, complete last sc with B, drop A and carry across tops of sts and work over strand with B, *with B, work popcorn in next ch, yarn over with A and draw through (to complete a ch and change color), drop B and carry along tops of sts and work over strand with A**, sc in each of next 4 ch, complete last sc with B, drop A and carry across tops of sts and work over strand with B, skip next ch; repeat from * across, ending last repeat at **, sc in each of last 3 ch – 20 popcorns. Fasten off.
Row 3: With right side facing, join A with a slip st in first sc of Row 2, ch 1, sc in first sc, *skip next 2 sc, (3 dc, picot, 3 dc) in top of next popcorn**, skip next sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * across, ending last repeat at **, skip next 2 sc, sc in last sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (Solid: 7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m).
Contrast A Light Gray (0341) 1 ball
Contrast B Minty (0520) 1 ball
Contrast C Cornmeal (0320) 1 ball
Contrast D Perfect Pink (0706) 1 ball
Contrast E Hot Red (0390) 1 ball
Contrast F Coral (0726) 1 ball
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at back of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice - 1 dcbp made.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice - 1 dcfp made.
Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 (3) sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Each small star measures approx 5" [12.5 cm] across at widest. Each large star measures approx 7" [18 cm] across at widest.
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Notes:
• Garland is made from 6 small stars, 6 large stars and a hanging cord. 
• The center of each star is worked in joined rounds. Each of six points is then worked back and forth in rows over a portion of the stitches in the last round of the center.
• Customize your garland by making as many small and large stars as desired using yarn colors of your choice.
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as a st.
CROCHET  I  SKILL LEVEL: EASY
MEDIUM
4

SMALL STARS (make 6 – 1 each with A, B, C, D, E, and F)
Center
Make an adjustable ring: Wrap yarn into a ring, ensuring that the tail falls behind the working yarn. Grip ring and tail between middle finger and thumb. Insert hook through center of ring, yarn over (with working yarn) and draw up a loop. Work stitches of first round in the ring. After the first round of stitches is worked, pull gently on tail to tighten ring.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 2. 12 dc in ring. Join with sl st in first dc. 12 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. Dcfp around next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 12 sc and 6 Dcfp.
First Point: Work now proceeds back and forth in rows.
1st row: (RS). Sl st in next st. Ch 1. sc in next st. Dcfp around next st. 1 sc in next st. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked for rem points. 3 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. Dcbp around next st. 1 sc in next st. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc3tog. Fasten off.
Next Point: 1st row: With RS facing, join yarn with sc in first unworked st of 2nd rnd: following previous point, Dcfp around next st. 1 sc in next st.
2nd and 3rd rows: As 2nd and 3rd rows of First Point. Fasten off. Rep Next Point until a total of 6 points have been made. Do not fasten off when last point is complete.
Border: With RS facing, ch 1. 1 sc evenly spaced around outer edge of Star, having (sc, ch 2, sl st in 2nd ch from hook, sc) at tip of each point. Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off.
Hanging Loop: With A, leaving a 5" [12.5 cm] long end, ch 10. Sl st in first ch to form loop. Fasten off, leaving a 5" [12.5 cm] long end. Use ends to tie loop to tip of one point.

LARGE STARS (make 6 – 1 each with A, B, C, D, E, and F)
Center
Make an adjustable ring.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 2. 12 dc in ring. Join with sl st in first dc. 12 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. Dcfp around next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 12 sc and 6 Dcfp.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in each of next 2 sts. Dcfp around next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 24 sc and 6 Dcfp.
First Point: Work now proceeds back and forth in rows.
1st row: (RS). Sl st in each of next 2 sts. Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Dcfp around next st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 5 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first 2 sts. Dcbp around next st. 1 sc in next 2 sts. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first 2 sts. Dcfp around next st. 1 sc in next 2 sts. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first 2 sts. Dcbp around next st. 1 sc in next 2 sts. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Dcfp around next st. Sc2tog. Turn. 3 sts.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. Dcbp around next st. 1 sc in next st. Turn.
7th row: Ch 1. Sc3tog. Fasten off.
Next Point: 1st row: With RS facing, join yarn with sc in first unworked st of 3rd rnd: following previous point, 1 sc in next st. Dcfp around next st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts.
2nd to 7th rows: Work same as 1st to 7th rows of first point. Fasten off. Rep Next Point until a total of 6 points have been made. Do not fasten off when last point is complete.
Border: Work same as border for small star.
Hanging Loop: Work same as hanging loop for small star.

HANGING CORD
With A, work a chain approx 70" [178 cm] long. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and in each rem ch across. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Thread hanging cord through hanging loops of stars, arranging them in any order you prefer.

materials: RED HEART® Baby Light™: 1 ball each Frosting A, 3724 Pinkie B, 3704 Happy C, 3258 Peachie D, 3538 Lilac E, 3825 Bluie F, 3820 Sky G, 3625 Sprout H, and 3410 Dolphin I
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.0mm [US H-8]
Yarn needle, piece of cardboard or cell phone or device 5"-6" [12.5-15 cm] long to use to wrap Tassels.
abbreviations: A, B, etc. = Color A, Color B, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] work direction in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Garland measures 39" [104 cm] across Tassel span plus 4" [10 cm] Rope Chain added to both ends. Tassels measure between 5"-6" [12.5-15 cm] long.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
TASSEL (make 3 of each color, 27 total)
With selected color, cut an 11" [28 cm] length of yarn and lay it across top of chosen object; this will be used to tie top of Tassel and to attach to Rope Chain. Wrap yarn around chosen object 15 times. Using 11" [28 cm] tie, knot top of Tassel tightly. Cut Tassel at opposite end. Using matching color for Tassel, cut a 24" [61 cm] long length of yarn for wrapping neck of Tassel. Wrap around Tassel 5 times and knot ends together. Allow ends to become part of Tassel.
ROPE CHAIN
With A, ch for 47" [120 cm].
Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; fasten off.
ASSEMBLY
Leaving 4" [8 cm] at each end unworked, use ties at top of Tassels to attach each one to Rope Chain 1½" [4 cm] apart in this order: (3 A, 3 B, 3 C, 3 D, 3 E, 3 F, 3 G, 3 H, 3 I). Weave in all ends. Trim Tassels as needed.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Spring Green (0672) 1 ball or 84 yds/77 m
Contrast B Saffron (0234) 1 ball or 28 yds/26 m
Contrast C Persimmon (0220) 1 ball or 110 yds/100 m
Contrast D Pretty ‘n Pink (0722) 1 ball or 60 yds/55 m
Contrast E Shocking Pink (0718) 1 ball or 113 yds/103 m
Contrast F Turqua (0512) 1 ball or 28 yds/26 m
Contrast G Delft Blue (0885) 1 ball or 40 yds/36 m
Contrast H Orchid (0530) 1 ball or 89 yds/81 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® yarn needle
Susan Bates® stitch markers
abbreviations: Picot = Ch 3. Sl st in first chain
measurements: Approx 90" [228.5 cm] long, not including Hanging Loops.
gauge: 12 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
GARLAND
Notes:
• Ch 2 at beg of row/rnds does not count as st.
• Ch 3 at beg of row/rnds counts as dc, unless otherwise stated.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st unless otherwise stated.

Rose (Make 8).
See Diagram on page 4.
With E, ch 27.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to last ch. 1 hdc in last ch. Turn. 25 sts.
2nd row: Ch 3. *3 dc in each of next 3 dc. Sl st in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Fasten off.
Coil strip into Rose and sew through layers to secure.

Wisteria (Make 5).
See Diagram on page 4.
With H, ch 4. Join with sl st in first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 7 sc into ring. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 10. 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 3 sc in each of next 8 ch. *1 sc in next sc. Ch 10. 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 3 sc in each of next 8 ch. Rep from * 5 times more. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Coil each “petal”.

Pansy.
See Diagram on page 4.
Make 4 with B as Color 1 and F as Color 2.
Make 6 with B as Color 1 and G as Color 2.
With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in ring. Ch 2) twice. (2 sc in ring. Ch 5) 3 times. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
2nd rnd: Join Color 2 with sl st to first ch-2 sp. Ch 2. (2 hdc. Picot. 2 hdc) all in same ch-2 sp. Skip next sc. Sl st in next sc. (2 hdc. Picot. 2 hdc) all in next ch-2 sp. *Skip next sc. Sl st in next sc. (1 hdc. 9 dc.1 hdc) all in next ch-5 sp. Rep from * twice more. Skip next sc. Sl st in next sc. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off.

Carnation (Make 4).
See Diagram on page 5.
With C, ch 5, leaving a long tail to use for gathering center of flower closed. Join with sl st in first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc. 2 hdc. 2 dc. 3 tr) all in ring. Join with sl st in first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working behind 1st rnd, sl st in ring between first 2 sc. Ch 3. Sl st in ring between next 2 hdc. Ch 3. Sl st in ring between next 2 dc. Ch 3. Sl st in ring between next 2 tr. Ch 3. Sl st in ring after last tr. Ch 3. Join with sl st to first sl st. 5 ch-3 loops.
3rd rnd: *Ch 1. (5 dc. Sl st) in next ch-3 loop. Rep from * around. 5 petals.
4th rnd: Ch 1. Working behind last rnd, 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 5. Sl st in sp between next 2 petals. Rep from * 3 times more. Ch 5. Join with sl st in first sc. 5 ch-5 loops.
5th rnd: *Ch 1. (2 dc. 4 tr. 2 dc. Sl st) in next ch-5 loop. Rep from * around. 5 petals.
6th rnd: Ch 1. Working behind last rnd, 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 7. Sl st in sp between next 2 petals. Rep from * 3 times more. Ch 7. 5 ch-7 loops.
7th rnd: *Ch 1. (3 dc. 5 tr. 3 dc. Sl st) in next ch-7 loop. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first ch 1. 5 petals.
Fasten off. Using long tail from beg and yarn needle, gather center tog tightly to close center of flower.

Daisy (Make 6).
See Diagram on page 5.
With B, ch 2.
1st rnd: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 10 sc. Fasten off.
3rd rnd: Join D with sl st to first sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Ch 7. 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. Skip next sc of last rnd. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around, ending with sl st in first sc. 5 petals.
Note: 5 petals from 3rd rnd will alternate with 5 petals from 4th rnd.
4th rnd: Ch 1. Working behind last rnd, 1 sc in next skipped sc from 2nd rnd. *Ch 7. 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. Skip next sc of 3rd rnd. 1 sc in next skipped sc from 2nd rnd. Rep from * around, ending with sl st in first sc. 5 petals. Fasten off.

Large Leaf (make 10).
See Diagram on page 5.
With A, ch 8.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 5 hdc in last ch. Do not turn. Working into opposite side in rem loops of foundation chain, 1 hdc in next ch, 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. 1 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

Small Leaf (make 10).
See Diagram on page 5.
With A, ch 5.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in next ch. (2 hdc. Ch 2. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 2 hdc) in last ch. Do not turn. Working into opposite side in rem loops of foundation chain, work 1 dc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

Hanging Strand
See Diagram on page 5.
With A, ch 278.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 9th ch from hook (skipped 8 ch counts as first hanging loop). 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Ch 8. Sl st in bottom of last hdc (second hanging loop made). Fasten off. 270 hdc and 2 ch-8 sps.

Optional – Corner Hanging Loops.
To hang Garland from a Mirror or Frame, measure across the top of your desired location. Fold Hanging Strand in half to find center. PM on either side of center to match measurement of desired location. Join A with sl st at marker. Ch 10. Sl st in same sp as last sl st. Fasten off and rep at 2nd marker.

Assembly
With A and yarn needle, sew flower and leaf motifs to RS of Hanging strand as desired, leaving approx 1" [2.5 cm] of Hanging Strand visible at each end, not including Hanging Loops.

Contrast A Pagoda (COL0014)  1 ball

Size U.S. F/5 (3.75 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 4" x 224" [10 x 560 cm].
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Bunting:  Make a total of 56 Triangles as follows:
Make 7 with Color 1 as A and Color 2 as B.
Make 7 with Color 1 as B and Color 2 as A.
Make 7 with Color 1 as C and Color 2 as D.
Make 7 with Color 1 as D and Color 2 as C.
Make 7 with Color 1 as E and Color 2 as F.
Make 7 with Color 1 as F and Color 2 as E.
Make 7 with Color 1 as G and Color 2 as H.
Make 7 with Color 1 as H and Color 2 as G.
Triangle Note: See chart on page 2. With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in ring. (Ch 3. 3 dc) twice in ring. Ch 3. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
2nd rnd:  Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in last ch-3 sp of 1st rnd. Ch 1. *(3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc. Ch 1) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * once more. (3 dc. Ch 3.) in next ch-3 sp. With Color 2, join with sl st to top of ch-3.
3rd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in last ch-3 sp of 2nd rnd. Ch 1. *3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. Ch 1.) in next ch-3 sp.  Rep from * once more. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3) in next ch-3 sp. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
4th rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in last ch-3 sp of 3rd rnd. Ch 1. *(3 dc. Ch 1) in each ch-1 sp to next corner ch-3 sp. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc. Ch 1) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * once more. (3 dc. Ch 1) in each ch-1 sp to next corner ch-3 sp. (3 dc. Ch 3) in next ch-3 sp. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
5th rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in last ch-3 sp of 4th rnd. Ch 1. *(3 dc. Ch 1) in each ch-1 sp to next corner ch-3 sp. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc. Ch 1) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * once more. (3 dc. Ch 1) in each ch-1 sp to next corner ch-3 sp. (3 dc. Ch 3) in next ch-3 sp. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off.
Joining: 1st row: With I, ch 20 (tie). *Working along top edge of Triangles, 1 sc in each dc and ch-sp across. Rep from * across top of rem 55 Triangles. Ch 20 (tie). Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch and st to end of row. Fasten off.
Pompom: Wind Color 1 around 3 fingers 125 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to smooth round shade. Sew to Triangle point.

materials: RED HEART® Celebration™: 1 ball each 9340 Aqua/Silver A, 9840 Blue/Silver B, 9740 Pink/Silver C, 9540 Purple/Silver D, 9240 Lime/Silver E, and 9640 Gold/Silver F
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4.25mm [US G-6]
Yarn needle
fiberfill
stitch markers
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Finished Garland measures 44” (112 cm) long. Light bulb measures 2¼” (6 cm) x 3¼”(8 cm).
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions: FINISHING Weave in all ends except long sewing tail on Socket. Holding Light bulb pieces with Wrong Sides together and working through both thicknesses, sc evenly around leaving a 1” (3 cm) gap; draw up loop; stuff lightly with fiberfill; sc to close opening; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off. Place Light bulb into open end of Socket; with yarn needle threaded on long sewing end, whipstitch Socket to Light bulb. Assembly To make Garland, cut 2 strands of B 1½ yards long; with both strands threaded on yarn needle, string finished Bulbs on yarn by passing needle through tops of Sockets. Tie knots in each end of strands to hang. GARLAND Lightbulb (Make 2 each in A, B, C, D, and E) Ch 3; join with slip st to form ring. Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 1, work 8 hdc in ring; join – 8 hdc. Round 2: Ch 1, 2 hdc in each hdc around; join – 16 hdc. Round 3: Ch 1, [2 hdc in next hdc, hdc in next hdc] 8 times; join – 24 hdc. Fasten off. Socket (Make 5) With F, leaving long tail for sewing, ch 12; join with slip st to form ring. Round 1: Ch 1, sc in each ch around; do not join – 12 sc. Rounds 2-4: Working in back loops only, sc in each sc around. Joining Row: Fold socket in half; ch 1, holding both sides together and working through both thicknesses, sc in each sc across – 6 sc. Fasten off. NOTE Always join with slip st in first sc unless otherwise specified. Use stitch markers to keep track of rounds if desired.

Contrast A Red (00095) 1 ball (12 m/13 yds)

Contrast I Grape (00071) 1 ball (12 m/13 yds)
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stuffing.
Narrow ribbon.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Each bulb is approx 3" [7.5 cm] tall.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Bulb (Front and Back make alike). 
With color of choice, ch 2. 
1st row: (RS). 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
Turn.
2nd and alt rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to 
end of row. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next 
sc. 2 sc
in last sc. Turn. 5 sc.
5th and 7th rows: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc.  
1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. 
Turn. 9 sc at end of last row. 
8th to 10th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to 
end of row. Turn.  
11th and 12th rows: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in 
each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. 5 sts at end of 
12th row. Fasten off, leaving a long end. 
Sew sides of Front and Back, leaving top 
open. Stuff lightly. 
Bulb Top: 1st row: Join MC with sl st to 
first st at top right corner. Ch 1. Working 
through both thicknesses, 1 long sc in first 
st 2 rows below. (1 sc in next sc. 1 long sc 
in next st 2 rows below) twice. Turn. 5 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of 
row. Turn. 
3rd row: Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. 
Fasten off. 
Cord: With MC, ch 110. Sl st in 2nd ch 
from hook and each ch to end of chain. 
Fasten off. 
Cut ribbon into 4" [10 cm] long pieces. 
Attach ribbon to each Bulb Top. Tie 
ribbons to Cord, spacing evenly as shown 
in picture.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 389 Hunter Green A, 706 Perfect Pink B, 505 Aruba Sea C, 316 Soft White D, 324 Bright Yellow E, 319 Cherry Red F and 672 Spring Green G.
Susan Bate® Crochet Hook: 4mm [US G-6]
Yarn needle, small amount of stuffing
abbreviations: A, B, C, etc. = color A, B, C, etc.
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Garland measures 36” (91 cm) long.
gauge:
16 sts = 4” (10 cm); 16 rows = 4” (10 cm).
CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Top of Cupcake Flower
With F, ch 2; [slip st, ch 3] 4 times in 2nd ch from hook, slip st in first slip st. Fasten off.
With E embroider a French knot in center of each flower. Sew flowers in place to top of Frosting.
Embroider 4 French knots evenly spaced across the bottom front of each frosting: E on B, D on C, C on D, B on G and G on E.

GARLAND
Braid
Row 1 (Right Side): With A, ch 3; (3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in 3rd ch from hook; turn.
Row 2: Ch 3, (3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in ch-3 space of last row; turn.
Repeat Row 2 until 36”(91 cm) from beginning. Fasten off.

Cupcake Paper (Make 1 each B, C, D, E and G)
Row 1: Ch 8; sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 7 sc.
Rows 2-16: Ch 1, sc in back loop of each sc across; turn.
At end of Row 16, fold in half and slip st through back loops of Row 16 and beginning ch, making a circle. Fasten off leaving long end of yarn.

Frosting (Make 1 each B, C, D, E and G)
Round 1: Ch 2; 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; do not join but work in continuous rounds.
Round 2: 2 Sc in each sc around – 12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 18 sc.
Round 4: Sc in each sc around.
Round 5: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 24 sc.
Rounds 6-8: Sc in each sc around.
Round 9: [(Sc, hdc, dc) in next sc, skip next sc] 12 times, slip st in next sc. Fasten off.

Flatten Cupcake Paper and sew bottom seam. Put a tiny amount of stuffing inside. Put a tiny amount of stuffing in frosting and flatten frosting, then sew frosting in place, easing to fit, placing B frosting on G paper, C frosting on D paper, D frosting on B paper, G frosting on E paper, and E frosting on C paper.

Large Flower Center (Make 4)
With E, ch 2; 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off.

Petals (Make 2 F and 2 D)
Round 1: Working on Flower Center, join yarn in back loop of any sc with a sc; sc in same st as joining sc, 2 sc in back loop of each sc around; join with a slip st in front loop of first sc – 16 sc.
Round 2: Working in front loops only, ch 1, dc in same sc as slip st, (dc, ch 1, slip st) in next st, [(slip st, ch 1 dc) in next st, (dc, ch 1, slip st) in next st] 7 times.
Round 3: Working in remaining back loops of Round 1, ch 1, [(slip st, ch 2, tr) in next st, (tr, ch 2, slip st) in next st] 8 times; join with a slip st in first slip st. Fasten off.

Sew assembled flowers and cupcakes to Garland as shown.

materials: RED HEART 'Holiday': 1 Ball each 9040 Red/Silver A
6040 Green/Silver B
1040 White/Silver C
Crochet Hooks: 4mm [US G-6]
Yarn needle
30 Jingle bells
abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Garland measures 32½” long.
gauge: 14 sts = 4”; 7 rnds = 4” in dc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
GARLAND
Center: With A, ch 4; join with a slip st in first ch to form a ring; ch 1, (sc, 4 hdc) all into ring, drop A, DO NOT FASTEN OFF; following the A sts, join B with an sc in the ring, work 4 hdc into same ring, drop B, DO NOT FASTEN OFF.
Rnd 1: Pick up A, work 2 hdc into each B st – 10 hdc A; drop A, pick up B, work 2 hdc in each A st – 30 hdc B, drop B.
Rnd 2: Pick up A, 2 dc in next 10 hdc, hdc in next hdc, * hdc in next hdc, sc in next hdc, slip st in next hdc, ch 5 *; fasten off A leaving a long end to sew loop; pick up B, 2 hdc in next hdc; repeat from * to * across next 3 hdc; fasten off B leaving a long end to sew loop.
Make 9 more pieces with your choice of A+C, B+C, or A+B.
CONNECTING GARLAND PIECES
First Piece: Thread yarn needle with long end left after ch-5 and stitch into coaster near beginning of the chain to make a loop; secure yarn on wrong side. Repeat on opposite side of coaster.
Join 2nd Piece: Thread yarn needle with long end left after ch-5 of 2nd piece, weave through a finished loop, stitch into coaster near beginning of this chain; secure yarn. Complete a loop on opposite side of coaster.
Continue until all pieces are joined. Additional pieces can be added to make garland longer if desired. 
JINGLE BELL FRINGE
Thread three bells onto A; ch 1, pull first bell up to first ch, make a ch over bell, continue to ch for total of 13”, pull 2nd bell up, ch 3, pull 3rd bell up, ch 2. Fasten off. Tie in bow around joining loops.
Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/71 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Robin’s Egg (01215) 26 m/28 yds
Contrast B Red (00095) 26 m/28 yds
Contrast C Hot Green (01712) 26 m/28 yds
Contrast D White (00001) 26 m/28 yds
Contrast E Dark Pine (00016) 26 m/28 yds
Contrast F Hot Pink (01740) 26 m/28 yds
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 100" [254 cm] long. Each Circle: Approx 2½" [6 cm] diameter.
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd counts as hdc.
First Circle
With A, **ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 2) 4 times in ring. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Sl st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 2. 3 hdc in same ch-2 sp as last sl st. *Skip next sc. 4 hdc in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. 16 hdc.**
3rd rnd: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. Ch 2. Fasten off. 24 hdc.
Second Circle
With B, work from ** to ** as given for First Circle.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. (1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc) 3 times. 1 hdc in next hdc. Join with sl st to ch-2 sp of previous Circle. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc) 4 times. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. Ch 2. Fasten off. 24 hdc.
Third and rem Circles: Work as given for Second Circle, working Circles in following color sequence: C, D, E, F, A, B until Garland measures approx 100" [254 cm].

materials: RED HEART® Anne Geddes Baby™: 1 ball each of 100 Lily A, 702 Rosie B, 203 Daffodil C, 504 Robin D, and 591 Posy E Version 1
OR 1 ball each 100 Lily A, 203 Daffodil B, 504 Robin C and 801 Bluebell F Version 2
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 3.25 mm [US D-3] and 3.5 mm [US E-4]
Yarn needle
Sewing needle and matching sewing thread
Black embroidery floss and embroidery needle
Eight 7/8” (22 mm) coordinating buttons
abbreviations: A, B, C, D, E = color A, B, C, D, E
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Measurement: 8 pennants = 49” (122 cm) wide x 6” (15 cm) deep. Pennant = 5¼” (13.5 cm) wide x 6” (15 cm) tall
gauge: GAUGE: With larger hook, 20 sts and 18 rows sc = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com

Welcome Baby Bunting
Whether celebrating a newborn’s arrival or momentous first birthday, this bunting lends an air of happiness to the occasion. For everyday decorating crochet your pennants in your nursery’s colors and hang them at the window or on a wall.
For coordinating cube cozy and pillow see patterns LW3649 and LW3650.
Solid Pennant (make 4)
Starting at top, with A and larger hook, ch 26.
Row 1: Working in back bumps of ch, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn – 25 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in each st across to last 2 sts, sc2tog over last 2 sts, turn – 23 sts.
Rows 4-23: Repeat Rows 2-3 (10 times) – 3 sts at end of last row.
Row 24: Repeat Row 2.
Row 25: Ch 1, skip first st, sc2tog over last 2 sts, turn – 1 st. Fasten off.
Edging
Round 1: With right side facing and larger hook, join A with a slip st in top right-hand corner st, ch 1, working across opposite side of foundation ch, sc in each ch across, rotate to work across side edge, work 25 sc evenly spaced across to bottom point, 3 sc in point, rotate, work 25 sc evenly spaced along other side edge; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off A.
Work now progresses in rows.
Row 2: Ch 1, working across top edge of the pennant, sc in same st and in each st across to next corner, turn – 25 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in each of next 23 sts, 2 sc in last st, turn – 27 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each st across, ch 8, sl st in last sc made (button loop). Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Striped Pennant (make 4)
Make 1 pennant in stripes consisting of color A & each of the 4 colors for girl- B, C, D, E ( 1 pennant in stripes of color A & colors C & F & 2 pennants in B for boy version ).
Row 1-2: Following directions for the solid pennant, begin rows with colored yarn for 2 rows, add color A at end of 2nd stripe row, do not finish off colored yarn.
Row 3-4: Work 2 sc rows of color A, changing to colored yarn at end of 2nd stripe row, do not finish off color A.
Row 5-24: follow instructions for solid bunting in 2 stripe per color pattern as directed, do NOT change color at end of row 24.
Row 25: Ch 1 & turn, skip 1st st , sc 2 tog, finish off color A.
Edging
Round 1: With right side facing, join CC with a slip st in top right-hand corner st, ch 1, working across opposite side of foundation ch, sc in each ch across, rotate to work across side edge, work 25 sc evenly spaced across to bottom point, 3 sc in point, rotate, work 25 sc evenly spaced along other side edge; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off CC.
Bunny Head (make 2 in color of choice)
With smaller hook, ch 4.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, 2 sc in next, sc in last ch, turn – 4 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in each of next 2 sc, sc in last st, turn – 6 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each of first 2 sts, 2 sc in each of next 2 sc, sc in each of last 2 sts, turn – 8 sts.
Row 4: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each of next 6 sts, 2 sc in last st, turn – 10 sc.
Row 5-7: Sc in each st across, (10 sts).
Row 8: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in each of next 7 sts, sc2tog over last 2 sts, turn – 8 sc.
Row 9: Ch 1, sc in each of first 2 sts, [sc2tog over next 2 sts] twice, sc in last 2 sts, turn – 6 sts.
Row 10: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in each of next 3 sts, sc2tog over last 2 sts, turn – 4 sc.
Edging
Row 1: working across side edge, bottom edge and other side edge, work 21 sc evenly around around 3 sides, join with a slip st in first sc of Row 10. Fasten off.
Bunny Ears (make 2 for each bunny head)
With smaller hook, ch 5.
Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 3 ch, 5 hdc in next ch, working across opposite side of foundation ch, sc in each of next 3 ch, join with a slip st in next ch. Fasten off, leaving a sewing length.
Bear Head (make 2 in color of choice)
Work same as Bunny Head.
Bear Ears (make 2 for each bear head)
With smaller hook, make an adjustable ring. 
Round 1: Ch 1, work 8 sc in ring, do not join, tighten ring. Fasten off, leaving a sewing length.
Muzzle (make 4)
With smaller hook and A, ch 4.
Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, 3 sc in last ch, working across opposite side of foundation ch, sc in next ch, 2 sc in last ch, join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off A.
FINISHING
Refer to photograph while finishing. Sew Muzzle to Bunny or Bear face using sewing thread. For Bunny, stitch triangle shape at top of muzzle and fill in. Shape muzzle by making a vertical stitch with sewing thread at bottom center and pull tightly. For Bear, nose is located in middle of muzzle; stitch triangle shape and fill in. Embroider eyes on face. Sew Ears in place. Sew a Bunny or Bear Head in center of each Pennant. Sew Bunting onto pillow top using sewing thread in swag formation or as desired, leaving individual pennants loose.
